description: Erection of a two storey extension above existing building to provide 4no.x residential units comprising 3x3 bed and 1x2 bed units.
decision_conditions: The proposed development would extend more than 3.5m in height above the highest part of the roof of the adjoining terraced properties and the floor to ceiling height of an additional storey would exceed the lowest ceiling height of a storey of the existing building, contrary to AB.1 (d)(ii) and (g) of Class AB, Part 20, Schedule 2 of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

The proposed development by reason of its design, bulk, and massing would detract from the appearance of the building and would be out of character and unduly prominent within the streetscene, and represent a discordant and incongruous feature which would be detrimental to the character and appearance of the surrounding area. The resulting building would appear visually intrusive and incongruous and would not be sympathetic to local character or the surrounding built environment, contrary to the NPPF (2019) Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012) and Condition AB.2(1)(e) of Schedule 2, Part 20, Class AB of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

It has not been demonstrated that the loss of commercial car parking spaces would lead to overspill car parking on the public highway and would not increase car parking pressures and adversely impact highway safety, contrary to Condition AB.2(1)(a) of Schedule 2, Part 20, Class AB of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

Application Form - please correct the date of the Legal Agreement on the Application Form. The date was incorrectly entered as the date of this Discharge of Obligation application, and not the Legal Agreement itself.

Inspection: Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with information provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment: The works proposed are acceptable and will not have an adverse effect on the tree or reduce its amenity value. Recommendation: No objections.

Inspection: Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with information provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment: The works proposed are acceptable and will not have an adverse effect on the trees or reduce their amenity value. Recommendation: No objections.

We received an email confirmation on the rear neighbour, however there are two adjoining rear neighbours in our record '15 Oxford Crescent' and '17 Oxford Crescent'. Please confirm and amend the whole application form with correct adjoining neighbours.
